name: Polyvalent Capital
description: Multi-strategy Investment Fund helping its investors achieve great returns by dynamically allocating capital (and risk) to various investment universes: Public Equity, Fixed Income and Alternatives (PE/VC mostly) and various geographies given the dynamically changing global macroeconomic environment and regional perspectives and therefore the investment landscape and risk-return dynamics. Particular emphasis from mid-2018 has been on Venture Capital. The Fund started to invest in Late-stage venture companies, but we are selectively investing into Growth- and trying Early-stage as well. In Venture Capital, we always try to achieve high absolute returns, but also helping our companies achieve synergies by working with each other.
investmentAreas: Finance, Financial Services, Hedge Funds, Venture Capital
fundingStage: Pre-Seed / Seed, Series A/B, Series C & Beyond

name: Schwarzwald Capital Fund
description: Schwarzwald, established in 2021 and headquartered in Limassol, is a venture capital fund dedicated to investing in fintech and the creator economy. They support visionary entrepreneurs shaping a dynamic future through pioneering projects in the fintech and creator economy.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Influencer Economy, Social Media,

name: MVST:MG
description: MVST:MG is an angel investor focused on Pre-Seed & Seed tech investment startup companies. Their goal is to invest seed money in startups and expedite their journey to success by facilitating the achievement of key milestones such as developing Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) and Proof of Concepts (POCs). They are dedicated to identifying suitable venture capital partners for subsequent round A investments, with the ultimate aim of nurturing startups into profitable enterprises. Their mission focuses on supporting the development of innovative projects and advocating for a fresh approach to investment that empowers investors to back ambitious ventures. Additionally, they aim to unite a network of business angels possessing diverse expertise across multiple business sectors.
investmentAreas: Blockchain, Crypto, Web3, Gaming

name: ULTRA.VC
description: ULTRA.VC is an early-stage investor equipped with an in-house accelerator, providing comprehensive support for startups at the inception stage. They offer essential resources such as funding, expert guidance, and emotional support from experienced mentors who understand the entrepreneurial journey firsthand. Their investment strategy centers around verticals where the integration of technology and human potential can bring about substantial improvements in people's quality of life.
investmentAreas: Wellbeing, EdTech, Future of Work, Fintech, AI

name: JOINT JOURNEY
description: Joint Journey, founded by Sergey Dashkov, is a dynamic investment firm launched in 2016. With a robust portfolio exceeding 120 companies and investments totaling $43M, they focus on diverse sectors such as Big Data, FinTech, New Energy, VR, IoT, and BioTech. Known for their rapid and informed investment approach, ULTRA.VC empowers founders with operational autonomy while also serving as a founding partner of AngelsDeck Global Ventures, facilitating syndicate co-investments with over 500 active angel investors.
investmentAreas: Big Data, FinTech, New Energy, VR, Internet of Things, and BioTech

name: Insta Ventures
description: Insta VC, leveraging deep expertise in enterprise IT, SaaS startup operations, and mobile app publishing, specializes in B2B projects and selected B2C niches like D2C (direct-to-consumer businesses). They co-invest alongside lead investors, focusing 70% of their deals on the Nordics and Baltics, including Finland, Sweden, Estonia, and Lithuania. Another 15% comes from Central and Eastern Europe, with the remaining 15% from global regions. Insta VC avoids mobile gaming and hardware investments but finds hardware-enabled software ventures compelling. They typically invest between USD $100K and USD $500K initially, with a sweet spot around USD $250K, and may allocate up to USD $1,000K with follow-on investments for companies showing proven traction, usually exceeding €15k in monthly revenue.
investmentAreas: SaaS businesses B2B / B2B2C Marketplaces Enterprise software Mobile applications AdTech / MarTech FinTech ML / DL / AI AR / VR DevOps / Cloud EdTech Crypto / Blockchain

name: AddVenture
description: "AddVenture is an international venture capital fund distinguished by its sector-focused strategy, primarily investing in the Home & Local Services sector with a range from $1 to $20 million per investment. Their investment thesis centers on two primary areas: horizontal marketplaces that connect freelancers with job opportunities in home and local services, as well as SaaS solutions for workforce management. Additionally, AddVenture seeks to support vertically integrated service providers that offer trusted brands in sectors such as cleaning, beauty, storage, laundry & dry-cleaning, and legal services. They aim to back companies that ensure quality control and seamless service delivery, enhancing customer trust and satisfaction in these essential service sectors."
investmentAreas: HRTech, Wellness, Beauty, Marketplaces

name: Vershina Capital
description: Vershina Capital focuses on investing in late seed and Round A startups characterized by motivated founder teams, proven MVPs, and strong unit economics, poised to scale their business models across European and North American markets. They specialize in the Online Education/EdTech, FoodTech (e-grocery), and E-Commerce sectors. Vershina Capital provides comprehensive support to their portfolio companies, including access to industry-specific experts and advisors, assistance with fundraising efforts, and operational guidance aimed at fostering dynamic business growth. This support enables portfolio companies to gain a competitive advantage, surpass competitors, expand market share, and enhance company valuation.
investmentAreas: Online Education/EdTech, FoodTech (e-grocery) and E-Commerce sectors.

name: Bulba Ventures
description: Bulba Ventures was founded in March 2018 by Yury Melnichek, the founder of MAPS.ME and AIMATTER, and Andrei Avsievich. Their mission is to improve the quality of human lives by funding machine learning startups.
investmentAreas: AI, Machine Learning

name: Melnichek Investments
description: Melnichek Investments is dedicated to improving the quality of human lives by funding and supporting machine learning and biotech startups. The company leverages its owner's funds, sourced from the successful acquisitions of previous startups, including AIMATTER (creators of mobile applications Fabby and Fabby Look) acquired by Google, and Vochi (a mobile application for video editing) acquired by Pinterest.
investmentAreas: Biotech, AI, InsurTech, Aerospace, Robotics

name: Rider Global
description: Rider Global is an investment platform that partners with founders to facilitate qualitative growth and expansion. Leveraging their expertise in building IPO or exit-oriented companies from scratch, Rider Global's team has extensive experience managing startups and transforming small and medium-sized companies into flexible, responsive corporations. They are a stage-agnostic fund, considering investments from seed to late stage. Rider Global seeks companies with a proven track record, strong unit economics, clear product-market fit, and optimal market entry timing. They believe in people who push the boundaries of what is possible.
investmentAreas: Mobility, Logistics, Ecommerce, Marketplaces

name: Chrome Capital
description: Chrome Capital is an international investment firm specializing in high-growth, tech-driven companies that digitally transform everyday life. They provide entrepreneurs with world-class expertise and foster enduring, value-add partnerships. With a focus on collaboration, data-driven analysis, loyalty, and transparency, Chrome Capital builds deep relationships with founders to create outstanding, life-transforming companies.
investmentAreas: Consumer Internet / Mobile Applications, Marketplaces / Classifieds, Enterprise and SMB Software, Financial Technologies

name: D2 Digital Venture
description: D2 Digital Ventures operates with Fund I closed at $10 million and targets an AUM of $50 million for Fund II. The fund typically invests between $200,000 and $500,000 per company, focusing on industry leaders with valuations exceeding $500 million. Potential exit strategies for investors include share appreciation in the private market, IPO (subject to lock-up periods), and sales to strategic investors. D2 Digital Ventures targets companies offering on-demand services that transform daily routines, micro-mobility solutions (such as kick-sharing and car-as-a-service), e-learning platforms for lifelong education, cybersport initiatives, fintech innovations in digital assets, applied artificial intelligence projects, and deep-tech scientific inventions encompassing new materials and technologies. The fund's investment sectors encompass a broad spectrum, emphasizing innovation and transformative impact across diverse industries.
investmentAreas: Fintech, Edtech, Esports, Deep Tech, Marketplaces

name: GEM Capital
description: GEM Capital, established in 2017, is a prominent gaming VC investor operating in private equity and venture capital. Based in Paphos (Cyprus) and Dubai (UAE), GEM Capital manages a diverse portfolio of over 25 projects across Europe, the US, and Israel. Specializing in Games & Entertainment and Enterprise Venture sectors while exploring opportunities in other industries, GEM Capital prioritizes innovative founders with international ambitions and scalable business models. Recognized for its leadership in gaming investments, GEM Capital was named Best Investor of 2021 by App2top and ranks among the top global gaming VC funds in the InvestGame H1 2023 report.
investmentAreas: Augmented Reality, Casual Games, Console Games, Mobile Apps, Online Games, PC Games, Video Games, Virtual Reality

name: Jetpack Ventures
description: GEM Capital also engages in pre-seed and seed investments within its thematic areas of interest. Their angel syndicate supports passionate founders globally, focusing on cultivating exceptional companies. Typically serving as early investors, GEM Capital emphasizes founder-market fit and has backed startups that participated in prestigious accelerators and secured funding from leading venture capital firms around the world.
investmentAreas: Marketplace, Blockchain, Fintech, EdTech, HRTech

name: Bigspace Investments
description: Bigspace Investments is a privately owned and managed early-stage venture capital firm headquartered in Limassol, Cyprus. They specialize in investing in companies they are passionate about and where they can provide significant value. Bigspace Investments, led by a team of seasoned entrepreneurs with extensive experience in both investing in and founding startups, specializes in early-stage venture capital. They focus on investing in passionate founders and high-growth technology sectors like SaaS, Fintech, Cybersecurity, Legaltech, MedTech, Apps, and Marketplaces. Operating with a flexible approach, they prioritize swift decision-making, straightforward terms, and adding significant value to their portfolio companies. While their primary focus is within the EU, they are open to compelling investment opportunities globally, aiming to support startups wherever innovative ideas thrive.
investmentAreas: SaaS, Fintech, Cybersecurity, Legal & Legaltech, MedTech, Apps and Marketplace

name: Mueller Management
description: Mueller Investment is dedicated to providing capital, guidance, and a robust network to tech startups throughout Europe. Their mission is to collaborate closely with visionary tech businesses, offering support to help them achieve success. They focus on industries such as Software, Healthcare, and Consumer Goods on a global scale, investing primarily in Seed and Series A stages with an average check size of €100K+. Mueller Investment operates on guiding principles that emphasize the importance of relationships, aiming to leverage their experience and network of trusted investors for mutual benefit. They prioritize meaningful partnerships, committing to projects where they can significantly contribute, akin to an incubator experience. Their approach also emphasizes sustainable scaling, assisting startups in building effective teams within budgetary constraints.
investmentAreas: "Software Healthcare Consumer Goods"

name: Adiva Investments
description: "Adiva Investments Ltd. is an European venture capital firm focused on investing in Bitcoin and Lightning seed- and early-stage startups. Investing around these disruptors, the general partner of Adiva Investments has subject matter expertise in Bitcoin, Lightning and Payment, which it uses to support portfolio companies both from a technical diligence and a product development standpoint. Adiva believes that Bitcoin and Lightning has more to offer than just investing in a cryptocurrency. Adiva Investments invests as an Early Stage investor and Business Angel in the Pre-Seed-, Seed- and Startup-Stage in companies that develop new business models, applications, products and services based on Bitcoin and Lightning."
investmentAreas: Blockchain, Crypto Web4

name: Capinvest21
description: "Our main goal is to help building new and developing already running innovation companies in order to expand market relations, build respectable homeland and foreign companies and maximize investors’ earnings. Before 2015 we were investing in real sector of economy, predominantly into oil and gas companies, thus we are confident in this sphere and what’s more important we have connections. Since 2015 our company is focused on innovation projects, which we help to increase capitalization and maximize profits. We neither play stock nor exchange markets. We invest in businesses, which we fully understand and for which we can offer something more than just money, but our knowledge, connections and experience. We are interested in microfinance (starting with $25000) for promising startups. That’s why we founded Capinvest 21 Seed Venture Fund I. We use economic-mathematical models and instruments of financial forecasting to choose which project is good for investing. We also always trust our guts while choosing a project. We choose promising projects, help them to run their companies and raise their capital. We come from Tyumen, Siberia, but we work around the world. In addition our company’s priority is to fund startups from CIS, MENA and Asia. We not only provide you with finance, we also help you to successfully run your projects. Capinvest 21 can be a profile investor for already existing companies, which long for further development and need funding."
investmentAreas: "E-commerce & Mobile FoodTech, PropTech Fintech, blockchain & BaaS SaaS & Smart Cloud Advert technology"

name: EA Ventures
description: The $50 million fund managed by EA Ventures is designed to operate over a span of five years, targeting early-stage startups primarily at the Seed and Pre-Series A stages. EA Ventures typically invests between $0.5 million to $2 million per company, focusing on startups that have demonstrated traction and are poised for growth. This fund aims to support innovative ventures across various sectors, providing capital to fuel their development and expansion efforts during critical phases of their business lifecycle. Their strategic investment approach aims to nurture promising startups and help them achieve significant milestones on their path to scaling and market success.
investmentAreas: Seed, Pre Series A

name: Oggin
description: We drive growth and build value by connecting people, capital, ideas and opportunity. Oggin is an entrepreneurial private investment company focused on small-to-medium-sized enterprises and start-ups. We believe that by bringing together our experience, people, capital and ideas we create opportunity to grow and build value.
investmentAreas: Blockchain, Financial Services, Internet, Property Development, Property Management

name: Nucleus Ventures
description: Nucleus Ventures is a startup hub which runs programs that build scalable businesses attractive to investors. Nucleus Ventures is a leading entity in corporate innovation, venture building and advisory, with a track record of several ventures built, managed, and delivered to our clients; 10+ incubators & accelerators successfully created and operated, 250+ start-ups graduated, $300+ Million USD raised, 2000+ jobs created. This can only be accomplished by putting our network of subject matter experts, start-ups & entrepreneurs at the heart of our operation!
investmentAreas: Business Development, Consulting, Corporate Training, Financial Services, Incubators

name: ULTRA.VC
description: ULTRA.VC is an early-stage investor with an in-house accelerator supporting impact-driven entrepreneurs.We provide strategic funding, mentorship, and resources to help startups scale and achieve their goals. At ULTRA.VC, we are committed to fostering innovation and driving positive change in the world.
investmentAreas: Art, Charity, Corporate Training, Financial Services, FinTech, Information Technology

name: Embria
description: We found, fund and grow tech companies. International startup builder and investor that founds, funds, and grows tech companies. We found, fund, and grow tech companies since 2007. Currently, there are 20+ portfolio companies, successfully operating with over 2000 team members globally.
investmentAreas: Online games, Fintech, Wellness, Social, EdTech

name: Jetpack Ventures
description: Jetpack Ventures is a venture studio and platform that funds and builds the next-generation of technology companies. We are a close-knit group of swiss-army-knife co-founders and angel investors. We help ambitious entrepreneurs design and launch fantastic products. Our studio brings together resources, playbooks, systems, talent, and capital to accelerate ideas and turn them into world-class companies.
investmentAreas: Venture Capital, Private Equity, Principals, Investors

name: Gravity Ventures Incubator
description: Gravity is an advanced technology incubator empowering founders to create an impact, shaping the entrepreneurial community of the future. Gravity is a cutting edge, venture building incubator that fosters and propels innovation. Through constant interaction we empower founders to make real impact and shape the entrepreneurial community of tomorrow.
investmentAreas: Idea Validation , Business Modelling , Pitching , Prototyping, Commercialization

name: Aivitam Ventures (CY)
description: Global Fintech Hub: Venture Builder, Fintech Summit. The Future of Fintech, PR and Marketing Agency. Our mission is to provide a world‑class education for IT entrepreneurs and the community. We launched media for IT entrepreneurs and the community. During this 6-month program, you will learn the soft and hard skills you need to run your own business – by building a real company.
investmentAreas: Advertising Services, Finacial Services, Marketing, Sales
